Database
  • Introduction
  • Document database (Mongodb)

  1. Introduction

    Today (2019) there exists different types of database (storage service) for different purposes.

    1. RDBMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL): ACID (atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability), strong consistency, support transactions.
    2. Redis: key-value, in memory
    3. MongoDB: document-oriented database provides strong consistency, transaction on a single document, plenty of query.
    4. Dynamo: key-value and document database runs on cloud, built for scalability!!!, high throughput, availability and reliability in present of failures (no single master node)
      It provides eventual consistency instead of strong consistency.
    5. Cassandra: Column-family database

  2. Document database (Mongodb)

    Document

    A document is a self-contained piece of information, the format of a document can be JSON string, XML string??

    * Mongodb is good at storing JSON document.

    Organization

    Database (SQL Database) -> Collection (SQL Table)-> Document (SQL Row)

    Different from SQL, the documents are not structured. For example, {"name":"Nan", "age":24} and {"temperature":34, "humidity":23} can be stored in one collection.
